intro: Brickellia rosalesia, commonly known as the pink brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its flowers are pink to lavender in color, with tubular central discs surrounded by ray florets. Brickellia rosalesia is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
